title: netlib-scalapack does not build with Intel compilers 17.0.5
body:
Since I can not use `Intel-MKL` on a local cluster due to [this issue](https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/8324#issuecomment-393418311), I am trying to build `netlib-scalapack`. Unfortunately this does not work.

### Expected Result

`netlib-scalapack` installs.

### Actual Result

```
...
-- Check for working Fortran compiler: /home/woody/iwtm/iwtm108/spack/lib/spack/env/intel/ifort
-- Check for working Fortran compiler: /home/woody/iwtm/iwtm108/spack/lib/spack/env/intel/ifort  -- works
...

-- Testing FORTRAN_MANGLING
CMake Error at CMAKE/FortranMangling.cmake:65 (MESSAGE):
  FORTRAN_MANGLING:ERROR
  /home/woody/iwtm/iwtm108/spack/var/spack/stage/netlib-scalapack-2.0.2-tq237tf5zdj4vuu2f2ppo4wgu74fnu2d/scalapack-2.0.2/BLACS/INSTALL/xintface:
  error while loading shared libraries: libintlc.so.5: cannot open shared
  object file: No such file or directory

Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:124 (FORTRAN_MANGLING)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

Interestingly I do have 
```
    extra_rpaths:
     - /apps/intel/ComposerXE2017/compilers_and_libraries_2017.5.239/linux/compiler/lib/intel64
     - /apps/intel/ComposerXE2017/compilers_and_libraries_2017.5.239/linux/compiler/lib/intel64_lin
```
set and the library in question is there:

```
$ ls /apps/intel/ComposerXE2017/compilers_and_libraries_2017.5.239/linux/compiler/lib/intel64_lin | grep libintlc
libintlc.so
libintlc.so.5
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install netlib-scalapack%intel^openblas
```

### Information on your system

centos7
